result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey A Neugent was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Casey A Neugent is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Casey A Neugent was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
HUBER GRANTED UNDER JAIL RULES.
Consecutive to: 14CF226 and all other sentences.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey A Neugent

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Paid $579.00 by GPS to cover both cases 14CF226 & 14CF482.

Cases heard: 14CF226 & 14CF482, Defendant Casey A Neugent in court with attorney Kim Marie Zion.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In 14CF226, Court sentenced defendant to 2 months jail in each count, concurrent with each other. Jail start July 22, 2015 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. $543 costs on count 2, $343 costs on count 3. (18 days jail credit).   In 14CF482, 2 months jail, consecutive to 14CF226 and all other sentences. Huber granted. $443 costs. (24 days jail credit). Posted cash bond applied. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.

Cases called: 14CF226 & 14CF482, Defendant Casey A Neugent in court with attorney Kim Marie Zion.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Complaint filed in 14CF482. Reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to counts 2&3 in 14CF226 and ct. 2 in 14CF482. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment.  Cts. 1 in both cases dismissed. Disposition will be probation with conditions or jail time and costs.  Sentencing to be set today with Judicial Assistant for Br. 2

Defendant Casey A Neugent in court with attorney Kim Marie Zion.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zion requesting plea/sentencing hearing  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
with Motion to File Further Motions after Receipt of Discovery, Motion to Disclose Intent to use other crimes, wrongs and bad acts and Motion for Exculpatory Evidence filed by Atty. Kim Zion
and Notice of DNA and Witness List with Petition for Leave to file Additional Motions filed by Atty Kohlwey

Defendant Casey A Neugent in court with attorney Kim M. Zion.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $2,000 recog. bond with felony conds. & Maintain absolute sobriety.Time limits waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
